title: GATES / MANANA
description: A jolly, easy-going man at the very bottom entrance to the gates. He gives information about the scabs, the strike, the union boss, Measurehead and being a boiadeiro.

dialogueTree.title: Call Me Mañana: ""Olá, Tequila Sunset, boiadeiro gra..."
dialogueTree.text: "Olá, Tequila Sunset, boiadeiro grande!" He looks at you with soft and hazy eyes.

links.title: You: "(Attempt to establish contact.) "Li..."
links.text: (Attempt to establish contact.) "Listen, brother, there's something *important* I need to talk to you about..."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""What's that, boia?" He tilts his h..."
links.text: "What's that, boia?" He tilts his head slightly.

links.title: Rhetoric: "Now's your chance! Remember, commun..."
links.text: Now's your chance! Remember, communists are notoriously skittish, so it's best to *insinuate* your way in...

links.title: Composure: "Hold on: This isn't a man who goes..."
links.text: Hold on: This isn't a man who goes in for subterfuge. He prefers someone who'll look him in the eye and say exactly what's on his mind.

links.title: Rhetoric: "Okay, maybe it's time to abandon th..."
links.text: Okay, maybe it's time to abandon the subtle approach.

links.title: Composure: "It was a foolish approach to begin..."
links.text: It was a foolish approach to begin with.

links.title: You: ""I'm looking for some people who kn..."
links.text: "I'm looking for some people who know how to really grind a sausage, if you know what I mean."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""Hrmmm. Have you tried a butcher sh..."
links.text: "Hrmmm. Have you tried a butcher shop?" He looks at you with perfect equanimity.

links.title: You: ""It involves our mutual friend, Kra..."
links.text: "It involves our mutual friend, Kras." (Put your hands next to your head and curl your fingers like deer antlers.)

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""Don't think I've ever met a Kras,..."
links.text: "Don't think I've ever met a Kras, personally. Then again, I've never been to Graad." He narrows one eye at you.

links.title: You: ""I'm investigating a peculiar smell..."
links.text: "I'm investigating a peculiar smell, one with revolutionary implications."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""Could be coming from one of the ja..."
links.text: "Could be coming from one of the jammed lorries? Cargo's been sitting out for a while." He sniffs the air and looks toward the roundabout.

links.title: You: ""I'm looking for a secret cabal of..."
links.text: "I'm looking for a secret cabal of *mole people*."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""Hrmm... you might have to look els..."
links.text: "Hrmm... you might have to look elsewhere for help with that." He scratches his chin.

links.title: You: ""I believe there's a cell of radica..."
links.text: "I believe there's a cell of radical communists operating in Martinaise. Can you help me find them?"

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""Now that *is* an important subject..."
links.text: "Now that *is* an important subject, but also a sensitive one. Still, good of you to just come straight out with it. No beating about the bush..." He smooths the twin bars of his moustache.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Yes, he certainly has a way of jus..."
links.text: "Yes, he certainly has a way of just coming out and saying things that normal people wouldn't."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""So you've given up copping and now..."
links.text: "So you've given up copping and now you're hunting communistas. Care to say why?"

links.title: You: ""I'm not 'hunting' communists, I'm..."
links.text: "I'm not 'hunting' communists, I'm trying to get organised by them."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""Oh, I see..." He gives you an exag..."
links.text: "Oh, I see..." He gives you an exaggerated wink.

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""I wish I could help. Unfortunately..."
links.text: "I wish I could help. Unfortunately, I don't know many communistas."

links.title: You: ""I know you said you're not really..."
links.text: "I know you said you're not really a communist, but aren't you actually a communist?"

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""Maybe, maybe not." He shrugs. "Eit..."
links.text: "Maybe, maybe not." He shrugs. "Either way, I'm not institutional. A man's got to blaze his own trail, in my book..."

links.title: Savoir Faire: "Blazing his own trail, being his ow..."
links.text: Blazing his own trail, being his own man... not exactly your typical communist spiel.

links.title: Rhetoric: "Okay, so maybe he's not exactly a c..."
links.text: Okay, so maybe he's not exactly a communist, but there's definitely some communistic residue about him.

links.title: Call Me Mañana: "He snaps his fingers. "Ah, but you..."
links.text: He snaps his fingers. "Ah, but you know, I did meet a genuine *ideólogo* a few months ago. Perhaps he is your guy?"

links.title: You: ""What's an *ideólogo*?""
links.text: "What's an *ideólogo*?"

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""You know, a guy with a theory. Som..."
links.text: "You know, a guy with a theory. Someone who likes to pit his theory against other theories in deadly theory-combat."

links.title: You: ""Did he say his name was 'Steban,'..."
links.text: "Did he say his name was 'Steban,' by chance?"

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""Didn't say anything about his name..."
links.text: "Didn't say anything about his name. Wasn't the sort of encounter where names matter."

links.title: You: ""How did you meet him?""
links.text: "How did you meet him?"

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""It was late one night as I was lea..."
links.text: "It was late one night as I was leaving the harbour. He was waiting on the corner in a classic Saramirizian jacket, a lot like the one you've got there..."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""He asked me for a light. We shared..."
links.text: "He asked me for a light. We shared cigarettes. Then he asked if I ever thought about 'getting into some of the extra-physical branches of communism'."

links.title: Electrochemistry: "See? All this political chit-chat i..."
links.text: See? All this political chit-chat is just an excuse to rip tar with strangers. Let's say we just skip right to the good part, then?

links.title: You: ""Hang on. What does that mean, *the..."
links.text: "Hang on. What does that mean, *the extra-physical branches of communism*?"

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""No idea. I took it to mean he was..."
links.text: "No idea. I took it to mean he was asking me to join some sort of underground cell..."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""A very old-school organising techn..."
links.text: "A very old-school organising technique, the sort of thing communistas used to do before the Revolution."

links.title: You: ""What did you tell him?""
links.text: "What did you tell him?"

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""The same thing I always tell peopl..."
links.text: "The same thing I always tell people who try to press some claim on me: I said, 'Every boiadeiro rides alone'."

links.title: You: "(Nod.) "An extremely cool way to es..."
links.text: (Nod.) "An extremely cool way to establish contact. Wish I'd thought of that."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: "He shrugs. "It was alright. A littl..."
links.text: He shrugs. "It was alright. A little like something out of a Vespertine spy novel, but I must respect the effort."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""It was late one night as I was lea..."
links.text: "It was late one night as I was leaving the harbour. He was waiting on the corner in a bright white jacket, classic Saramirizian style..."

links.title: You: ""Okay, how do I find this guy?" (Pr..."
links.text: "Okay, how do I find this guy?" (Proceed.)

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""I couldn't tell you. Once I declin..."
links.text: "I couldn't tell you. Once I declined his offer, we finished our cigarettes and he disappeared back into the night. Just before he melted into the shadows he turned to me and said..."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""*Remember Dobreva and Abadanaiz*...""
links.text: "*Remember Dobreva and Abadanaiz*..."

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Wow, this one's a deep cut. Julia D..."
links.text: Wow, this one's a deep cut. Julia Dobreva and Jean Abadanaiz, popularly known as the 'Revolutionary Lovers', served as Dual Commissars of Revolution on the Insulindian front during the Antecentennial Revolution. Their forbidden love, as well as their disappearance during the final collapse of the Revacholian commune only contributed to their mystique...

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Their remains were discovered on a..."
links.text: Their remains were discovered on a beach in Ozonne in '35. Subsequent forensic analysis suggested suicide by poison.

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""... and then he was gone.""
links.text: "... and then he was gone."

links.title: You: ""Who are Dobreva and Abadanaiz?""
links.text: "Who are Dobreva and Abadanaiz?"

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""I don't know. Guess not everyone r..."
links.text: "I don't know. Guess not everyone remembers." A tight, half-smile crosses his face.

links.title: You: ""'The Revolutionary Lovers.'""
links.text: "'The Revolutionary Lovers.'"

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""So they were lovers, eh? Makes sen..."
links.text: "So they were lovers, eh? Makes sense, he seemed like a romantic, in his way."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""He's not the only one, it seems."..."
links.text: "He's not the only one, it seems." The lieutenant doesn't even look up from his notebook.

links.title: You: ""What do you think it means?" (Conc..."
links.text: "What do you think it means?" (Conclude.)

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""Been wondering about that myself."..."
links.text: "Been wondering about that myself." He scratches his chin. "Some communista inside-talk, could be. Not meant for the wider public. They love that kind of thing. You'd have to ask someone who knows this ideólogo personally..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""*Ahem*..." The lieutenant clears h..."
links.text: "*Ahem*..." The lieutenant clears his throat.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Not to interfere in your personal..."
links.text: "Not to interfere in your personal errand, but it might have something to do with that *passphrase* Cindy mentioned earlier."

links.title: You: ""Wait, what was that about again?""
links.text: "Wait, what was that about again?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""She said that you would need some..."
links.text: "She said that you would need some kind of *passphrase* to gain access to this so-called *mega secret* meeting." He snaps the elastic band around his notebook.

links.title: You: ""Oh, right. Good thinking, Kim.""
links.text: "Oh, right. Good thinking, Kim."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant nods."
links.text: The lieutenant nods.

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""Just in time, the faithful partner..."
links.text: "Just in time, the faithful partner arrives with the key that turns the lock. You two make a good pair..."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""I salute you, boias, and wish you..."
links.text: "I salute you, boias, and wish you good fortune on this grand ideological quest." He tips his hat ever so slightly.

links.title: You: ""I was totally about to say that.""
links.text: "I was totally about to say that."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Of course you were, detective. Apo..."
links.text: "Of course you were, detective. Apologies for interrupting." The lieutenant smiles to himself.

links.title: Conceptualization: "No, you weren't. Otherwise you *wou..."
links.text: No, you weren't. Otherwise you *would have* said it. In truth, it was quite beyond your associative powers.

links.title: You: ""That's really dumb. You should fee..."
links.text: "That's really dumb. You should feel embarrassed even suggesting that."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You're right. How foolish of me. W..."
links.text: "You're right. How foolish of me. Won't happen again, detective."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""Sound like you two may have been r..."
links.text: "Sound like you two may have been riding together too long. The strain of the open range, and so on..."

links.title: Logic: "Of course, such "inside-talk" might..."
links.text: Of course, such "inside-talk" might also serve as a handy passphrase...

links.title: You: ""That's alright. I think you may ha..."
links.text: "That's alright. I think you may have just given me the last piece of the puzzle."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""Is that so?" He raises an eyebrow...."
links.text: "Is that so?" He raises an eyebrow. "Well, in that case, I salute you, boia, and wish you good fortune on this grand ideological quest."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""I have to say, though: It sounds l..."
links.text: "I have to say, though: It sounds like you've found yourself a proper hunt."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""I have to say, though: It sounds l..."
links.text: "I have to say, though: It sounds like you've found yourself a proper hunt."

links.title: You: ""I thought you Union guys were all..."
links.text: "I thought you Union guys were all communists?"

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""Some are, some aren't." He shrugs...."
links.text: "Some are, some aren't." He shrugs. "It's a big institution, room for all kinds: communistas, Semenese supremacists, even an anti-institutional boiadeiro..."

links.title: Empathy: "There is warmth in his voice when h..."
links.text: There is warmth in his voice when he talks about the Union. Whatever his personal politics, this is his home.

links.title: Rhetoric: "Alright, so if he isn't personally..."
links.text: Alright, so if he isn't personally a communist, he's definitely hanging out with them.

links.title: You: ""Are you sure? You smell just like..."
links.text: "Are you sure? You smell just like a communist."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""Didn't realize you could smell com..."
links.text: "Didn't realize you could smell communism." He frowns. "But then, I've never studied the subject..."

links.title: Half Light: "You can smell all sorts of things....."
links.text: You can smell all sorts of things... fear, disgust, desire. Not communism, though.

links.title: Rhetoric: "Maybe it's not taught in any of you..."
links.text: Maybe it's not taught in any of your so-called universities, but there's definitely something going on here...

links.title: You: ""I'm on a sort of quest to develop..."
links.text: "I'm on a sort of quest to develop my political potential and I need their help."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""A fellow plains-roamer, in search..."
links.text: "A fellow plains-roamer, in search of greater understanding. A classic story..." He nods approvingly.

links.title: You: ""Honestly, I had a weird dream and..."
links.text: "Honestly, I had a weird dream and now I need to get to the bottom of it."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""Chasing a dream, huh? I have to re..."
links.text: "Chasing a dream, huh? I have to respect that, boia..." He gives you a small salute.

links.title: You: ""What I'm trying to say is: I'm loo..."
links.text: "What I'm trying to say is: I'm looking for communists. You know any?"

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""Ah, now I see. Can't say I'm surpr..."
links.text: "Ah, now I see. Can't say I'm surprised. You seem to take your communism seriously. Not a bad thing, mind you. It's good for a man to take time to think about the whole socio-political world picture."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Oh, he certainly likes to take his..."
links.text: "Oh, he certainly likes to take his time with things, especially when politics are at issue."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""Communistas, huh? Can't say that's..."
links.text: "Communistas, huh? Can't say that's where I thought you were heading with this. Not that I'm criticizing. It's good for a man to take his time and think about the whole socio-political world picture."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It's certainly been an interesting..."
links.text: "It's certainly been an interesting development to witness first-hand."

links.title: You: ""What will *you* be doing now?""
links.text: "What will *you* be doing now?"

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""I'll be okay here, doing lookout."..."
links.text: "I'll be okay here, doing lookout." He surveys the red flags, draped from the harbour gates. "Quite the sight, aren't they? Getting to like that red, I am..."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""Don't worry about me. I live to al..."
links.text: "Don't worry about me. I live to alleviate the worries of our brothers. See if any other insane killers turn up. Then I'll run. And live."

links.title: You: ""I'm sure you'll do good.""
links.text: "I'm sure you'll do good."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""You know it, friend." He smooths h..."
links.text: "You know it, friend." He smooths his moustache with his hand.

links.title: You: ""Try not to get shot, eh?""
links.text: "Try not to get shot, eh?"

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""I'm sure I'll be luckier than you,..."
links.text: "I'm sure I'll be luckier than you, friend." His grin is as wide as a desert.

links.title: You: ""That weasel I visited. Turns out h..."
links.text: "That weasel I visited. Turns out he has one hell of a colonial mug collection."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""Yeah..." He nods, rubbing his chin..."
links.text: "Yeah..." He nods, rubbing his chin. "The janitor who gave me the key to his apartment said the guy's a bit of an asshole."

links.title: You: ""Yes, his mug-collection certainly..."
links.text: "Yes, his mug-collection certainly represented... *antiquated* social values."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""Like I said before, I don't know m..."
links.text: "Like I said before, I don't know much about this weasel, but the bossman said he's a real piece of work." He touches his beret. "Thanks for helping out, friend."

links.title: You: ""See how we're all busy concentrati..."
links.text: "See how we're all busy concentrating on the racist mugs? That's what the ruling class wants."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""Yeah, it would be really bad if we..."
links.text: "Yeah, it would be really bad if we got into an argument about it. Waste of a good noon. Or afternoon? Or night?" He looks around, oblivious suddenly. "Anyway, thanks for helping out, friend."

links.title: You: ""A man with such a funny mug collec..."
links.text: "A man with such a funny mug collection can't be that bad."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""I don't know about that. Anyway, l..."
links.text: "I don't know about that. Anyway, like I said before, bossman said that weasel's not a friendly *boia*." He touches his beret. "So thanks for helping out."

links.title: You: ""All I'm saying is he had lots of m..."
links.text: "All I'm saying is he had lots of mugs."

links.title: You: ""Evrart said you have a key to a do..."
links.text: "Evrart said you have a key to a door?"

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""A key, huh?" He runs his fingers t..."
links.text: "A key, huh?" He runs his fingers through his moustache. "What door is this key supposed to open?"

links.title: You: ""He said it belonged to a weasel.""
links.text: "He said it belonged to a weasel."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""Oh, say no more. I got you." He ta..."
links.text: "Oh, say no more. I got you." He taps the side of his nose with a little wink.

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""I got *that* key right here. And l..."
links.text: "I got *that* key right here. And let me tell you, it's mighty good of you to help us out during the strike -- working class solidarity, as they say."

links.title: You: ""I saw an opportunity and I took it..."
links.text: "I saw an opportunity and I took it. I'm a hustlegrinder."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""Hehe, I'm not so sure about the hu..."
links.text: "Hehe, I'm not so sure about the hustle-grind, but..." He waves at you. "You know, it doesn't matter. It's a good thing you're doing. Thanks."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""What you're looking for is a basem..."
links.text: "What you're looking for is a basement door behind the greenhouse -- that's behind the Whirling-in-Rags -- that's all I know. Our organisation is what you call *compartmentalized*. Means we keep out of each other's business."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Okay, but where did you get the ke..."
links.text: "Okay, but where did you get the key from?"

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""The janitor gave it to me. Nice fe..."
links.text: "The janitor gave it to me. Nice fella. We talked about life and things that really, *truly* matter." His gaze wanders off into the distance.

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""None of this mess we're in. This j..."
links.text: "None of this mess we're in. This jivin' and jugglin'... What's it for?" He doesn't wait for your answer. "To feed our children I guess."

links.title: You: ""*Anything* else I should know abou..."
links.text: "*Anything* else I should know about this task? This weasel person? When he'll be home?"

links.title: Call Me Mañana: "He shakes his head. "I'm more of a..."
links.text: He shakes his head. "I'm more of a philosophical dockworker. I like to talk about the big picture stuff. Who I am. Who you are. What we are fighting for..." The man takes a big sip from his flask.

links.title: Rhetoric: "He means he's not gonna tell you, '..."
links.text: He means he's not gonna tell you, 'cause he doesn't know. But he will shoot his mouth off with you now that you're working for Evrart.

links.title: Inland Empire: "Who *he* is and what they're fighti..."
links.text: Who *he* is and what they're fighting for? This is interesting.

links.title: Physical Instrument: "Ask him about the Hardie boys."
links.text: Ask him about the Hardie boys.

links.title: You: ""Got it.""
links.text: "Got it."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""I'm more of a philosophical dockwo..."
links.text: "I'm more of a philosophical dockworker, see -- I like to talk about the big picture stuff. Who I am. Who you are. What we are fighting for..." The man takes a big sip from his flask.

links.title: You: ""Where did you get the key from?""
links.text: "Where did you get the key from?"

links.title: You: ""I heard something about a weasel a..."
links.text: "I heard something about a weasel and it didn't sound like a local *polar* weasel, if you know what I mean." (Wink.)

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""Polar weasel? Oh... I know what yo..."
links.text: "Polar weasel? Oh... I know what you mean. I'm pretty sure he's actually Occidental though. So you're gonna be commitin' fratricide, my racist friend."

links.title: You: ""I'm not opening this door for myse..."
links.text: "I'm not opening this door for myself. I'm opening it for all working men."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""I knew this man was a commie." He..."
links.text: "I knew this man was a commie." He smiles, tilting his head. "And it's a good thing you're doing too. Thanks."

links.title: You: ""I'm not really doing this for poli..."
links.text: "I'm not really doing this for political reasons."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""Oh so the none-of-the-above type,..."
links.text: "Oh so the none-of-the-above type, are you? I get it, I get it. I like to keep my distance too." He nods. "But it doesn't matter. It's a good thing you're doing. Thanks."

links.title: You: ""I was hoping you could tell me.""
links.text: "I was hoping you could tell me."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""Of course. I got you -- you don't..."
links.text: "Of course. I got you -- you don't know anything." He taps the side of his nose with a little wink.

links.title: You: ""I don't know, some whistleblower's..."
links.text: "I don't know, some whistleblower's I think?"

links.title: You: ""Actually do you know anything abou..."
links.text: "Actually do you know anything about the Hardie boys?"

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""Los Ardies?" He smiles. "They're a..."
links.text: "Los Ardies?" He smiles. "They're an independent militant group. A bit too high-strung, but it comes with the responsibility."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""They're sort of like you. Preserve..."
links.text: "They're sort of like you. Preserve the rule of law and all that. Except it's Evrart's law." He takes a swig from his flask. "But, really, they're just like you."

links.title: Authority: "Is he actually comparing you -- an..."
links.text: Is he actually comparing you -- an officer of the law -- to some neighbourhood vigilantes?!

links.title: Rhetoric: "Come on. He's just trying to keep t..."
links.text: Come on. He's just trying to keep the peace.

links.title: You: ""There is only one law, friend -- a..."
links.text: "There is only one law, friend -- and that's me!"

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""Why not? Must be nice being someth..."
links.text: "Why not? Must be nice being something else for a change. The rest of us are just folks."

links.title: You: "Let it go."
links.text: Let it go.

links.title: You: ""Why are you striking?""
links.text: "Why are you striking?"

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""We're negotiating our share.""
links.text: "We're negotiating our share."

links.title: You: ""Your... share?""
links.text: "Your... share?"

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""Aye." He seems pleased with himsel..."
links.text: "Aye." He seems pleased with himself.

links.title: You: ""Wait, so not wages or pensions or...."
links.text: "Wait, so not wages or pensions or..."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""This stuff -- they already covered.""
links.text: "This stuff -- they already covered."

links.title: You: ""Shouldn't you be grateful then? It..."
links.text: "Shouldn't you be grateful then? It's a lot more than most people here have."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""Never grateful. Were we ever grate..."
links.text: "Never grateful. Were we ever grateful, we'd have nothing. You fight for every piece."

links.title: You: ""At least you got the benefits, tha..."
links.text: "At least you got the benefits, that's something."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""It's not enough. Not enough to get..."
links.text: "It's not enough. Not enough to get ahead. More about keepin' us in our place."

links.title: You: ""However much you feed the wolf...""
links.text: "However much you feed the wolf..."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""... the wolf always wants more. I..."
links.text: "... the wolf always wants more. I like wolves."

links.title: You: ""How large a *share* would you like?""
links.text: "How large a *share* would you like?"

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""All of it. However, right now we w..."
links.text: "All of it. However, right now we want all the harbour workers to be on the company's board, so they could take part in *the decision-making process*."

links.title: Rhetoric: "This seditious talk sounds like com..."
links.text: This seditious talk sounds like communism. (Just so we're on the same page: Communism is basically wanting to kill the rich people or deporting them to a labour camp in southeast Graad. But don't say that out loud if you're a communist.)

links.title: You: ""You seem to have the wrong idea he..."
links.text: "You seem to have the wrong idea here. The board of a major company is not *council democracy*."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""Quite a shitty board, I must say...."
links.text: "Quite a shitty board, I must say. Means someone's gotta reform it. I, for one, want to face the *fat ones'*, when decisions are made."

links.title: You: ""The fat ones, always leeching on t..."
links.text: "The fat ones, always leeching on the honest man."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""You see, the owners already benefi..."
links.text: "You see, the owners already benefit greatly from the harbour. No one can doubt that. They get so much."

links.title: You: ""Right.""
links.text: "Right."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""Aye, now here's the thing... at an..."
links.text: "Aye, now here's the thing... at any time, some other capitalist could take the place over with the blink of an eye, without even owning any of the buildings."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: "He takes a swig from his flask. "So..."
links.text: He takes a swig from his flask. "So why should they be the *only* ones with the power to take stuff over?"

links.title: You: ""But don't you think the owners hav..."
links.text: "But don't you think the owners have a right to the harbour? Didn't they organize it into existence?"

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""Hey, if the rich folk screw over p..."
links.text: "Hey, if the rich folk screw over poor folk, with little concern for their merits or futures, why shouldn't poor folk screw over rich folk from time to time?"

links.title: You: ""I guess that makes sense.""
links.text: "I guess that makes sense."

links.title: You: ""It's still kinda confusing to me,..."
links.text: "It's still kinda confusing to me, but whatever."

links.title: You: ""So you feel like you should also g..."
links.text: "So you feel like you should also get something?"

links.title: You: ""I don't think I understand.""
links.text: "I don't think I understand."

links.title: You: ""And you're the ones to reform, thu..."
links.text: "And you're the ones to reform, thus reaping your own benefits?"

links.title: You: ""Are you a... communist?""
links.text: "Are you a... communist?"

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""No," he pauses to think for a mome..."
links.text: "No," he pauses to think for a moment. "I don't think I'm a communist. Seeing something of value and saying *I want it all to myself* is a much older and simpler notion. No science to it at all..."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""Even a weak child can think it. Th..."
links.text: "Even a weak child can think it. The only things holding someone back are *I can't* and *I shouldn't*."

links.title: You: ""But the stuff you do aligns admira..."
links.text: "But the stuff you do aligns admirably well with the World Republic, why not call yourself a communist?"

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""I have nothing against communists,..."
links.text: "I have nothing against communists, they are honourable boiadeiros." He takes a swig from his flask. "And they have good analysis."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""But my own code serves me well. If..."
links.text: "But my own code serves me well. If my code starts failing -- a code can fail a man as well as a man can fail a code -- then I will have to submit to a new one. Which may well be communism."

links.title: Composure: "He knows who he is. Firmly grounded..."
links.text: He knows who he is. Firmly grounded -- has no need to reinforce or elaborate his political identity to himself or others.

links.title: You: ""I guess I understand...""
links.text: "I guess I understand..."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""See, I am primarily a lazy person...."
links.text: "See, I am primarily a lazy person." He looks very amused, as if thinking about some private joke or mystery.

links.title: Rhetoric: "No doubt he's communist enough to c..."
links.text: No doubt he's communist enough to call himself such. But he won't.

links.title: You: "Why is that?"
links.text: Why is that?

links.title: Rhetoric: "He likely believes that when someon..."
links.text: He likely believes that when someone has radical ideas, he should still rather present himself as a self-interested moderate, not as a missionary of a minority ideology.

links.title: You: "Because?"
links.text: Because?

links.title: Rhetoric: "It might come in handy to present i..."
links.text: It might come in handy to present ideas as a part of reality -- the only reality that exists -- instead of some abstract *true form*. On the other hand, he's not lying when performing this sleight of hand. He's a self-interested moderate.

links.title: You: ""Basically, you're a self-intereste..."
links.text: "Basically, you're a self-interested moderate?"

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""That's one way to call it, friend...."
links.text: "That's one way to call it, friend." He chuckles. "An unnecessarily complicated way."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Laziness, self-interest, and negli..."
links.text: "Laziness, self-interest, and negligence certainly fit the doctrine espoused here."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""Is it the dulcet tone of ultralibe..."
links.text: "Is it the dulcet tone of ultraliberalism I hear?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""At least some people are willing t..."
links.text: "At least some people are willing to make the necessary sacrifices in order to reach higher, and to better the world."

links.title: You: "That's a strange way to go about it..."
links.text: That's a strange way to go about it.

links.title: You: "I don't want to talk about these in..."
links.text: I don't want to talk about these interesting things. It's not my business.

links.title: Rhetoric: "But certainly you have to form an o..."
links.text: But certainly you have to form an opinion on everything and then tell it to everyone.

links.title: You: ""I am not sure I understand.""
links.text: "I am not sure I understand."

links.title: You: ""It sounds like you're a communist..."
links.text: "It sounds like you're a communist who thinks he isn't doing enough to call himself one."

links.title: You: ""Right on, brother.""
links.text: "Right on, brother."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""Just the way the world works, boia..."
links.text: "Just the way the world works, boiadeiro."

links.title: You: ""You shouldn't take what's not your..."
links.text: "You shouldn't take what's not yours."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""Then how can anything ever be 'min..."
links.text: "Then how can anything ever be 'mine'? But that's okay -- we don't have to agree. The prairie is wide enough for all of us."

links.title: You: ""Cool. I don't have anything to add..."
links.text: "Cool. I don't have anything to add to that."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""A *none-of-the-above* kind of man?..."
links.text: "A *none-of-the-above* kind of man? No harm in being that."

links.title: You: ""The bossman, Evrart, what can you..."
links.text: "The bossman, Evrart, what can you tell me about him?"

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""I think it's best you make up your..."
links.text: "I think it's best you make up your own mind, now that you've met him." He shrugs. "In my eyes, he is a capable organizer and a decent businessman."

links.title: You: ""What does bossing the Union entail..."
links.text: "What does bossing the Union entail anyway?"

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""I guess you kinda get to be the vi..."
links.text: "I guess you kinda get to be the village chief. He oversees the harbour, makes deals with the owners or other relevant parties. Watches out for his own."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""By that you mean corruption?""
links.text: "By that you mean corruption?"

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""By Heavens, why would he not be co..."
links.text: "By Heavens, why would he not be corrupt? We live in a harsh and disordered world, see. And in this world..."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""... the old man is corrupt for our..."
links.text: "... the old man is corrupt for our *benefit* and we know it. Appreciate it, even. He is, personally, not too lavish."

links.title: You: ""That desk seemed lavish to me.""
links.text: "That desk seemed lavish to me."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""He is *reasonably* lavish, sure. T..."
links.text: "He is *reasonably* lavish, sure. That's his prerogative. It's not like you want a saintly demeanour on a corrupt motherfucker. That would be a manipulative illusion."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""Besides, there are no non-corrupt..."
links.text: "Besides, there are no non-corrupt systems in the world anyway. And *moralism* is the most corrupt of them all."

links.title: Authority: "Not you, you would like to say... B..."
links.text: Not you, you would like to say... But then there's that weasel door.

links.title: Rhetoric: "This man has political theory -- an..."
links.text: This man has political theory -- and it has not failed him today.

links.title: You: ""You're right. He's very ascetic.""
links.text: "You're right. He's very ascetic."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""Okay, he's *reasonably* lavish, su..."
links.text: "Okay, he's *reasonably* lavish, sure. That's his prerogative. It's not like you want a saintly demeanour on a corrupt motherfucker. That would be a manipulative illusion."

links.title: You: ""You mean corruption?""
links.text: "You mean corruption?"

links.title: You: ""I guess you're right, I should." (..."
links.text: "I guess you're right, I should." (Conclude.)

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""He's probably in his container at..."
links.text: "He's probably in his container at the harbour, so head right on in there." He re-adjusts the beret on his head.

links.title: You: ""You seem to have spent a lot of ti..."
links.text: "You seem to have spent a lot of time thinking about the political situation."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""Sure, I've had the necessary free..."
links.text: "Sure, I've had the necessary free time." He spreads his arms wide, using the reach to show how much time he has. "Fortunately, there's always time."

links.title: Composure: "The look in his brown eyes conjures..."
links.text: The look in his brown eyes conjures up an understanding: for him, having command of his time is the most important thing.

links.title: Encyclopedia: "It all comes together now, the way..."
links.text: It all comes together now, the way he speaks about scabs, his general attitude. He's a follower of a 500-year-old Franconigerian boiadeiro code -- itself an appropriation of Vespertine cool...

links.title: Encyclopedia: "That of a noble peasant or a travel..."
links.text: That of a noble peasant or a travelling herdsman. True to yourself, independent in your actions, loyal to your friends.

links.title: You: "Maybe I am a boiadeiro?"
links.text: Maybe I am a boiadeiro?

links.title: Encyclopedia: "No."
links.text: No.

links.title: You: "I could..."
links.text: I could...

links.title: Encyclopedia: "No."
links.text: No.

links.title: You: "But..."
links.text: But...

links.title: You: "What if..."
links.text: What if...

links.title: You: "Maybe..."
links.text: Maybe...

links.title: You: "Unless..."
links.text: Unless...

links.title: You: "It doesn't sound that cool. Sounds..."
links.text: It doesn't sound that cool. Sounds antiquated, obsolete, *passé*. It's not *disco*.

links.title: Call Me Mañana: "The man sits on the railing, his ha..."
links.text: The man sits on the railing, his hands reaching far and wide, yet it feels as if he could effortlessly go even wider, if need be. An endless torrent of time.

links.title: You: ""Got the picture. Let me ask you so..."
links.text: "Got the picture. Let me ask you something else."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""Sure thing." A gust of wind blows..."
links.text: "Sure thing." A gust of wind blows through his hair.

links.title: Suggestion: "What is this, news of the world? Ta..."
links.text: What is this, news of the world? Talk about *personal stuff*. Get to know him.

links.title: Rhetoric: "This was great. You feel mentally r..."
links.text: This was great. You feel mentally reinvigorated.

links.title: Encyclopedia: "*The board* is where the stockholde..."
links.text: *The board* is where the stockholders send their representatives. Often those representatives don't even represent the stockholders' interests. It's not actually like some council-based democracy.

links.title: You: ""Oh, okay. Economy stuff. I get it...."
links.text: "Oh, okay. Economy stuff. I get it. I want to talk about something else."

links.title: You: ""I've come to Martinaise investigat..."
links.text: "I've come to Martinaise investigating a murder."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""Murder, huh? That sounds like a lo..."
links.text: "Murder, huh? That sounds like a lot of hard work. You'd never see me investigating a murder."

links.title: You: ""It's actually very fun and easy.""
links.text: "It's actually very fun and easy."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""I don't believe you. Poste L'Avent..."
links.text: "I don't believe you. Poste L'Aventurier said the same thing. They tried to get me to be their postman. So fun, so easy, they said. It's just walking." He shakes his head at the memory.

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""It wasn't. I'm doing much better h..."
links.text: "It wasn't. I'm doing much better here at the harbour. Being an honest Union man with *a lot* of free time on his hands."

links.title: Endurance: "He doesn't have the stamina to deli..."
links.text: He doesn't have the stamina to deliver mail on these tough streets. But *you* do. Maybe if this cop thing doesn't work out...

links.title: You: ""You're right. It's almost impossib..."
links.text: "You're right. It's almost impossible. I'm 91% sure I'll never get it solved."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""Probably not." He nods. "I wouldn'..."
links.text: "Probably not." He nods. "I wouldn't even know where to start with that. Much better here at the harbour -- for an honest Union man like me."

links.title: You: "(Whisper) "I have no idea what I'm..."
links.text: (Whisper) "I have no idea what I'm *doing*."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: "He whispers back: "That's okay. I h..."
links.text: He whispers back: "That's okay. I have no idea what I'm doing either. I don't even know what day it is..." He thinks and then decides: "Don't tell me. It's a *better* day that way."

links.title: You: ""Maybe you want to help me solve it..."
links.text: "Maybe you want to help me solve it by telling me who did it?"

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""Of course, *policía*." He gives yo..."
links.text: "Of course, *policía*." He gives you a sly smile. "It wasn't me. You can rule me out. Easier that way."

links.title: Volition: "Should we? He's *nice*. I don't lik..."
links.text: Should we? He's *nice*. I don't like *nice*.

links.title: Drama: "He didn't do it. It's the truth."
links.text: He didn't do it. It's the truth.

links.title: You: ""Hey, you're the man in boots at th..."
links.text: "Hey, you're the man in boots at the gates -- Cuno said you know about the armour."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""Heh." He smiles. "The little *boia..."
links.text: "Heh." He smiles. "The little *boia* did good on his promise."

links.title: You: ""His promise?""
links.text: "His promise?"

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""To get me into trouble. To *sic th..."
links.text: "To get me into trouble. To *sic the pigs* on me -- pardon the choice of words. Not mine."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""What happened?""
links.text: "What happened?"

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""I was asked to look into that armo..."
links.text: "I was asked to look into that armour situation. Official Union probe, you know -- track it down, see who took it."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Did you?""
links.text: "Did you?"

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""At first I thought -- why not, may..."
links.text: "At first I thought -- why not, maybe the pieces can feed the strike? Buy us a few more days under the sun, you know."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""So I went to this boy. He said he'..."
links.text: "So I went to this boy. He said he'll make me his *prison bitch*. He's got *eyes everywhere*, the cops in his pocket and he's the king of Jamrock."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""Serves me right for doing menial f..."
links.text: "Serves me right for doing menial footwork. I dropped that probe right then and there -- and it *still* got me into trouble," he smiles. "One bad move is all it takes."

links.title: You: ""So Cuno used us to, what? Scare yo..."
links.text: "So Cuno used us to, what? Scare you?"

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""It's a minor nuisance. It's all go..."
links.text: "It's a minor nuisance. It's all good." He contemplates taking a swig from his flask.

links.title: Electrochemistry: "He thinks -- not yet. Better to get..."
links.text: He thinks -- not yet. Better to get this business out of the way. Sweeter then.

links.title: You: ""The probe into the armour -- what..."
links.text: "The probe into the armour -- what did you learn?"

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""I learned that people don't want t..."
links.text: "I learned that people don't want to talk to a drunk Union man about some armour."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""What else?""
links.text: "What else?"

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""Not much. Technical stuff mostly...."
links.text: "Not much. Technical stuff mostly. That was the interesting part."

links.title: You: ""Okay. Anything else?""
links.text: "Okay. Anything else?"

links.title: You: ""What sort of technical stuff?""
links.text: "What sort of technical stuff?"

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""I did some research into this *arm..."
links.text: "I did some research into this *armadura*. Let's say I have friends at the library," he explains with a wry smile. "I didn't get into the material science, just how it comes off."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""How *does* it come off?""
links.text: "How *does* it come off?"

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""In parts. Four in total. The helme..."
links.text: "In parts. Four in total. The helmet was the first to go, the kid says he tore it off and kicked it into the sea. I believe him. The boots were still on the guy last I saw. Too hard to remove."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""So -- as I count -- there are two..."
links.text: "So -- as I count -- there are two parts missing: the gauntlets and the cuirass. This is where I left off. Too much hassle. More like a job for some *milicia*."

links.title: You: ""Four pieces of armour up for grabs..."
links.text: "Four pieces of armour up for grabs, then. But I already sent the boots away..."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: "The jolly man shrugs. "I guess you..."
links.text: The jolly man shrugs. "I guess you won't be collecting them all then. That's less work for you, at least!"

links.title: You: ""Hold up. Four pieces? Helmet, cuir..."
links.text: "Hold up. Four pieces? Helmet, cuirass, gauntlets, boots... what about the leggings?"

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""Oh, they're just gone. They don't..."
links.text: "Oh, they're just gone. They don't exist anymore, if they ever did at all." He gives you a jolly shrug. "Forget about them. I did."

links.title: You: ""I've already got some armour. I'm..."
links.text: "I've already got some armour. I'm pretty happy without struggling to find more."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""So you have." He smooths a stray m..."
links.text: "So you have." He smooths a stray moustache hair with his thumb and smiles. "No wonder you're a detective!"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""He can be very *enterprising*..."..."
links.text: "He can be very *enterprising*..." The lieutenant looks at his feet, hiding his face.

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "You have no business with those boo..."
links.text: You have no business with those boots. But here we are.

links.title: You: ""I'm going to find *one* piece of i..."
links.text: "I'm going to find *one* piece of it. One is enough."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Nice and balanced," the lieutenant..."
links.text: "Nice and balanced," the lieutenant nods. "Some junior officers can take care of the rest."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""Smart choice," the moustached man..."
links.text: "Smart choice," the moustached man agrees. "It's only that *one* spot you need armoured too -- the one the bullet hits."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""Good luck if you go for those boot..."
links.text: "Good luck if you go for those boots, though. You'd have an easier time wrestling the spurs off a boiadeiro than getting them off him."

links.title: You: ""I'm ambitious. I'm going to find *..."
links.text: "I'm ambitious. I'm going to find *all of it*. All the pieces."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""All of it?" The lieutenant raises..."
links.text: "All of it?" The lieutenant raises his brow. "There are junior officers out there, eager to prove themselves. I would leave *some* for them, but okay. Let's find *all of it*."

links.title: Rhetoric: "It's implied he finds it unlikely t..."
links.text: It's implied he finds it unlikely that you will succeed in this.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""All of it?" The lieutenant raises..."
links.text: "All of it?" The lieutenant raises his brow. "There are junior officers out there, eager to prove themselves. I would leave *some* for them -- and I would leave the *boots* to Processing -- but okay. Let's find *all of it*."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""A Mesquese epic then, all across M..."
links.text: "A Mesquese epic then, all across Martinaise." He glances south, where the canal runs: "I hope it will be a real *bonanza* for you."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""Especially getting those boots off..."
links.text: "Especially getting those boots off him. You'd have an easier time wrestling the spurs off a boiadeiro than that."

links.title: You: ""Yes, I'm already on it.""
links.text: "Yes, I'm already on it."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""Yes." He nods. "You said as much.""
links.text: "Yes." He nods. "You said as much."

links.title: You: ""Actually, I may have better things..."
links.text: "Actually, I may have better things to do too."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I agree, officer. Let's focus on t..."
links.text: "I agree, officer. Let's focus on the hanging and later some junior officers can take care of the rest."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""Nice." The moustached man nods in..."
links.text: "Nice." The moustached man nods in approval. "From what I learned it was a very heavy, boring set of armour."

links.title: You: ""How then?""
links.text: "How then?"

links.title: You: ""Thank you for the cooperation, sir.""
links.text: "Thank you for the cooperation, sir."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""No problem." He finally takes a sw..."
links.text: "No problem." He finally takes a swig from the flask. "If you see that kid, thank him from Call Me Mañana. Thank him for showing me the *way*."

links.title: Empathy: "He is sincerely grateful he is not..."
links.text: He is sincerely grateful he is not tracking down pieces of armour right now.

links.title: You: ""Did you?""
links.text: "Did you?"

links.title: You: ""What happened?""
links.text: "What happened?"

links.title: You: ""Cuno told me you were supposed to..."
links.text: "Cuno told me you were supposed to know about the armour."

links.title: You: ""I'm looking for assistance with a..."
links.text: "I'm looking for assistance with a *dead body* situation."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""Body still hangin' in the tree?" H..."
links.text: "Body still hangin' in the tree?" He rubs his chin as if pondering his core beliefs. "Aye, that's a rough pickle... can't help you with that, sorry."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""I'm not really an admirer of dead..."
links.text: "I'm not really an admirer of dead bodies. Might be someone else from the Union can render assistance..." He shrugs.

links.title: Physical Instrument: "What's the matter with this wimp? I..."
links.text: What's the matter with this wimp? Is he obstructing *justice*?!

links.title: You: ""Stop being a wimp, you need to hel..."
links.text: "Stop being a wimp, you need to help me out right *now*!"

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""No need to get aggressive." He tak..."
links.text: "No need to get aggressive." He takes a swig from his flask. "I'm really not the one to ask."

links.title: You: ""Why not? I need to get through the..."
links.text: "Why not? I need to get through the gate to the harbour. You need to let me in!"

links.title: You: ""I need to get past the gates and s..."
links.text: "I need to get past the gates and speak with your boss."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""Oh. Good, good! What matters do yo..."
links.text: "Oh. Good, good! What matters do you want to discuss with Evrart?"

links.title: You: ""He might have information about a..."
links.text: "He might have information about a killing that took place behind the hostel."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""Evrart's got a lot of knowledge ab..."
links.text: "Evrart's got a lot of knowledge about a lot of things, aye. Doesn't often dole it out, though. But sure, why not..."

links.title: You: ""There's been talk of suspicious ac..."
links.text: "There's been talk of suspicious activity at the harbour."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""Suspicious activity? How very trou..."
links.text: "Suspicious activity? How very troublesome... yet, take a look around. Strikers, protests, scabs -- isn't it all so very suspicious?" He smiles widely.

links.title: You: ""I can't disclose any details of an..."
links.text: "I can't disclose any details of an on-going case."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""So mysterious. So intriguing." The..."
links.text: "So mysterious. So intriguing." The man gives out a jolly chortle. "Either way, the road in front of you is wide and open."

links.title: You: ""I need to know what's behind these..."
links.text: "I need to know what's behind these gates. I'm *exploring*."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""My friend, I respect the right to..."
links.text: "My friend, I respect the right to roam. The open range awaits..." He gazes over the roundabout with a glint of longing.

links.title: You: ""Does this mean you can let me thro..."
links.text: "Does this mean you can let me through the gate?"

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""I don't operate in that capacity...."
links.text: "I don't operate in that capacity. I'm not a *granter of passage*." He takes a swig and points up the stairs with his flask. "The passage grants itself."

links.title: Empathy: "Beneath the jolliness he suddenly s..."
links.text: Beneath the jolliness he suddenly seems doubtful.

links.title: Logic: "If it's so simple -- why did the sc..."
links.text: If it's so simple -- why did the scab leader warn you of the guards blocking the way?

links.title: You: ""That simple? I just walk in?""
links.text: "That simple? I just walk in?"

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""Aye -- walk right past Measurehead..."
links.text: "Aye -- walk right past Measurehead and go in."

links.title: You: ""Measurehead? I think I met him.""
links.text: "Measurehead? I think I met him."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""Yeah, the two-and-a-half-metre tal..."
links.text: "Yeah, the two-and-a-half-metre tall Semenese supremacist up there." He points to the bridge above the gates. "Walk right past him..."

links.title: You: ""Right.""
links.text: "Right."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""... then press the button to unloc..."
links.text: "... then press the button to unlock the door..."

links.title: You: ""Aha.""
links.text: "Aha."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""... then go past him again...""
links.text: "... then go past him again..."

links.title: You: ""Okay.""
links.text: "Okay."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""... and you enter the harbour thro..."
links.text: "... and you enter the harbour through the office. Esta!"

links.title: You: ""Hmm, for some reason it doesn't se..."
links.text: "Hmm, for some reason it doesn't seem like it's going to be that easy..."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""Don't worry, I'm sure it's not *co..."
links.text: "Don't worry, I'm sure it's not *completely* impossible. For example, you could best Measurehead in a physical confrontation."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""Or you could convert to his Semene..."
links.text: "Or you could convert to his Semenese supremacist world view. Or, hmm," he strokes his moustache, "maybe it actually *is* completely impossible."

links.title: You: ""Has anyone here ever bested him in..."
links.text: "Has anyone here ever bested him in a physical confrontation?"

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""Not yet, no." He fixes his eyes on..."
links.text: "Not yet, no." He fixes his eyes on you, evaluating your prowess. "He's... incredibly strong."

links.title: Physical Instrument: "Nothing a couple of solid hooks fro..."
links.text: Nothing a couple of solid hooks from Dexter and Sinister won't fix.

links.title: You: ""Has any of the scabs tried convert..."
links.text: "Has any of the scabs tried converting to his world view?"

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""Jean-Luc himself would say the phi..."
links.text: "Jean-Luc himself would say the philosophy has proven... *overly heroic* for the scabs to convert to. Not enough intuition."

links.title: You: ""Got it. Another thing...""
links.text: "Got it. Another thing..."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""Sure." The man whistles a jaunty t..."
links.text: "Sure." The man whistles a jaunty tune, the wind rustling his whiskers.

links.title: You: ""Uh. Gotcha. I think I have some qu..."
links.text: "Uh. Gotcha. I think I have some questions for you first."

links.title: You: ""Past Measurehead?""
links.text: "Past Measurehead?"

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""Yeah, the two-and-a-half-metre tal..."
links.text: "Yeah, the two-and-a-half-metre tall Semenese supremacist there." He points to the bridge above the gates. "Walk right past him..."

links.title: Logic: "If it's all so simple -- why don't..."
links.text: If it's all so simple -- why don't the strikebreakers just go up the stairs?

links.title: You: ""The Measurehead thing didn't go we..."
links.text: "The Measurehead thing didn't go well for me. Could you help me with that somehow?"

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""Sorry. Busy surveying the situatio..."
links.text: "Sorry. Busy surveying the situation." He takes a swig from his flask. "I'm sure you'll figure something out. You guys have all sorts of gadgets these days."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""Wire tapping. Telescopic batons. F..."
links.text: "Wire tapping. Telescopic batons. Futuristic circuit-bending to infiltrate harbour machinery. Maybe you could even knock that Kvalsund crane over using some remote controls..."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: "He stops to think. "Or... calling i..."
links.text: He stops to think. "Or... calling in tactical air support! You guys have air support, right?"

links.title: You: "(Turn to Kim.) "Wait, we have *air..."
links.text: (Turn to Kim.) "Wait, we have *air support*?! Why didn't you tell me?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Because we don't. We don't have ai..."
links.text: "Because we don't. We don't have air support -- or any of those other things."

links.title: You: ""We sure do, and don't you forget i..."
links.text: "We sure do, and don't you forget it."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""Aye-aye, sir." The easy-going man..."
links.text: "Aye-aye, sir." The easy-going man winks at you.

links.title: Suggestion: "Something changes in his dispositio..."
links.text: Something changes in his disposition. A merciful smile in the corner of his eye.

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""All right, I may have *some* advic..."
links.text: "All right, I may have *some* advice for you on how to deal with Jean-Luc there -- out of solidarity to the RCM. It's low on technology, however."

links.title: You: ""Yes?""
links.text: "Yes?"

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""First -- don't fight him. Obviousl..."
links.text: "First -- don't fight him. Obviously. Second, get him to share his theory by being *subordinate*. Admit your lack of expertise. Basically grovel. That's how I'd do it," he tips his beret and concludes: "You're welcome."

links.title: Conceptualization: "Hmm... maybe that *would* work? We'..."
links.text: Hmm... maybe that *would* work? We'll have to see.

links.title: You: ""I'm pretty sure we don't. At least..."
links.text: "I'm pretty sure we don't. At least not all of these things."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""I get it, hush-hush about the secr..."
links.text: "I get it, hush-hush about the secret technology." He pats the side of his nose with his index finger.

links.title: You: ""I'm actually a worker, like you gu..."
links.text: "I'm actually a worker, like you guys!" (Show him the stolen card.)

links.title: Call Me Mañana: "The man looks at the colourful piec..."
links.text: The man looks at the colourful piece of plastic, then at you, then back at the card, then at you again.

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""That's a good one. But I know you'..."
links.text: "That's a good one. But I know you're not a dockworker. I even gave you that key to the weasel den, remember?" He raises his flask. "Now how can I help you?"

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""Umm..." He looks at his flask for..."
links.text: "Umm..." He looks at his flask for a moment. "But that's not you, officer?"

links.title: You: ""It's an old picture.""
links.text: "It's an old picture."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""From back when you were not a cop,..."
links.text: "From back when you were not a cop, but a heavy-set dark-skinned dockworker named *Santiago John*?"

links.title: You: ""Yes.""
links.text: "Yes."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""Highly unlikely. I've known John f..."
links.text: "Highly unlikely. I've known John for several years now. Also, you *told* me you're a cop, remember? How did you get his shift card?"

links.title: You: ""Does not seem plausible, now that..."
links.text: "Does not seem plausible, now that I think of it."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""Yes, and you also *told* me you're..."
links.text: "Yes, and you also *told* me you're a cop. But now that this is settled..." He leans in to inspect the card. "How did you get his shift card?"

links.title: You: "(Take a close look at the card.) "G..."
links.text: (Take a close look at the card.) "Guess not."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""Good thing too. I've known Johanne..."
links.text: "Good thing too. I've known Johannes for a few years now, be *sinister* if he turned into a completely different person overnight."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: "He leans in to inspect the card. "H..."
links.text: He leans in to inspect the card. "How did you get his shift card anyway?"

links.title: Drama: "Now you're in a mess. The time hath..."
links.text: Now you're in a mess. The time hath not arrived. Sorry.

links.title: You: ""I literally stole it off him while..."
links.text: "I literally stole it off him while he slept."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""Oh, John's been out drinking himse..."
links.text: "Oh, John's been out drinking himself blind again? He should watch his step, that John. Can I have the card?"

links.title: Interfacing: "No. It will prove useful still, bel..."
links.text: No. It will prove useful still, believe your thieving fingers.

links.title: You: ""Sure, I have no real need for it.""
links.text: "Sure, I have no real need for it."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""Thank you plenty. I'll make sure J..."
links.text: "Thank you plenty. I'll make sure John gets his card back."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""You're quite the righteous man." H..."
links.text: "You're quite the righteous man." He smiles appreciatively. "Honour allows us to keep a respectful distance from each other. So, what do you need?"

links.title: Authority: "You feel like you earned a signific..."
links.text: You feel like you earned a significant amount of honour points today.

links.title: You: ""No, I'm afraid. The card's evidenc..."
links.text: "No, I'm afraid. The card's evidence in an on-going investigation."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""Oh, is my friend in some sort of t..."
links.text: "Oh, is my friend in some sort of trouble? Who knew..."

links.title: You: ""No, I need to continue my undercov..."
links.text: "No, I need to continue my undercover infiltration of this compound. Otherwise it's as if I just stole the card for no reason."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""Oh, okay. Good luck with that." He..."
links.text: "Oh, okay. Good luck with that." He tips his beret. "So, what do you need?"

links.title: You: ""I found it on the ground. At the W..."
links.text: "I found it on the ground. At the Whirling-in-Rags."

links.title: You: ""It was like a sign, the wind depos..."
links.text: "It was like a sign, the wind deposited it before my feet. I feel a closeness to this person."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""Yes," he nods solemnly. "The city..."
links.text: "Yes," he nods solemnly. "The city has a way of pairing souls. John's been out drinking himself blind..."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""He should be more careful, that Jo..."
links.text: "He should be more careful, that Johannes. Can I have the card?"

links.title: Drama: "He can't know that. Maybe you're ju..."
links.text: He can't know that. Maybe you're just younger on the photo.

links.title: You: ""I'm a bit short on *money* right n..."
links.text: "I'm a bit short on *money* right now. Can you give me some of it?"

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""Sure thing, my friend, I can help..."
links.text: "Sure thing, my friend, I can help you out." He flips a coin toward you.

links.title: You: "Try to catch it."
links.text: Try to catch it.

links.title: Hand/Eye Coordination: "The coin lands into your hand as if..."
links.text: The coin lands into your hand as if it has always belonged there. The swallow returns.

links.title: You: ""Appreciated.""
links.text: "Appreciated."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""Always glad to help out the RCM. S..."
links.text: "Always glad to help out the RCM. Shame I can't do more -- things are meagre at the moment, due to..." He nods toward the protesters.

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""You know -- the winter's fat is sl..."
links.text: "You know -- the winter's fat is slowly running out and all. Still better than scabbing, though."

links.title: You: ""The Union has problems getting by?""
links.text: "The Union has problems getting by?"

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""Nothing to worry about, really. Th..."
links.text: "Nothing to worry about, really. The jam's a bit of a mess, cargo can't get in or out. The rationing is a bit stricter, is all. Supplies should last the strike, though."

links.title: You: ""Every little bit helps, you know.""
links.text: "Every little bit helps, you know."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""I'm always glad to help out when p..."
links.text: "I'm always glad to help out when possible -- not like these slithering scabs." He looks at them in disbelief.

links.title: You: ""Gotta spend money to make money.""
links.text: "Gotta spend money to make money."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""Aye, you lost me there, honcho. Bu..."
links.text: "Aye, you lost me there, honcho. But it's okay as long as you're not a sorry-ass scab." He looks at them in disbelief.

links.title: You: "Say nothing, pocket the coin."
links.text: Say nothing, pocket the coin.

links.title: Hand/Eye Coordination: "The coin narrowly slips by your out..."
links.text: The coin narrowly slips by your out-stretched fingers and falls to the ground.

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""Oh! I'm sorry... didn't mean to th..."
links.text: "Oh! I'm sorry... didn't mean to throw it like that. It's a thing we harbour folk do, passing around cargo and such."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: "He rubs the back of his head. "Was..."
links.text: He rubs the back of his head. "Was not meant as... provocation or ridicule."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "Lieutenant Kitsuragi picks up the c..."
links.text: Lieutenant Kitsuragi picks up the coin and hands it to you.

links.title: You: ""Appreciated.""
links.text: "Appreciated."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""Right, always glad to help out the..."
links.text: "Right, always glad to help out the RCM! We're on the same branch, you and I. Humans, I mean, not slithering scabs."

links.title: You: ""I almost had a heart attack...""
links.text: "I almost had a heart attack..."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""I'm really sorry, friend. Frittte'..."
links.text: "I'm really sorry, friend. Frittte's nearby, get some *nosaphed*." He points to the boutique just right of him. "Good stuff. Helps against heart attacks too."

links.title: You: "Say nothing, pocket the coin."
links.text: Say nothing, pocket the coin.

links.title: You: "Let it fall on the ground."
links.text: Let it fall on the ground.

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""Oh, sorry, friend. Didn't mean to..."
links.text: "Oh, sorry, friend. Didn't mean to throw it like that... it's a thing we harbour folk do. Comes naturally."

links.title: You: ""Don't worry. Much appreciated." (P..."
links.text: "Don't worry. Much appreciated." (Pick up coin.)

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""Right, always glad to help out! We..."
links.text: "Right, always glad to help out! We're on the same branch, you and I. Not like these slithering scabs."

links.title: You: "Say nothing, pick up and pocket coi..."
links.text: Say nothing, pick up and pocket coin.

links.title: You: "Leave the coin where it landed."
links.text: Leave the coin where it landed.

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""Man of honour." He raises his eyeb..."
links.text: "Man of honour." He raises his eyebrow. "I respect that. We were talking about scabs, yeah?"

links.title: You: ""What's the strike about anyway?""
links.text: "What's the strike about anyway?"

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""Serious business, as I'm sure you..."
links.text: "Serious business, as I'm sure you now realize. The boss would have been glad to tell you. Alas, you cannot get to him anymore."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""You know... serious business." He..."
links.text: "You know... serious business." He smiles. "I'm sure the big boss would be glad to tell you. You'll have to ask him first."

links.title: Suggestion: "He's a chatty guy. *Wants* to talk..."
links.text: He's a chatty guy. *Wants* to talk about the strike. Return once you've met the Union boss, and are on a better footing with the organization.

links.title: Rhetoric: "He's a chatty guy. *Wants* to talk..."
links.text: He's a chatty guy. *Wants* to talk about the strike too. Just can't break the command structure and tell you now.

links.title: Rhetoric: "Feels like he's hinting at somethin..."
links.text: Feels like he's hinting at something, but you're too hungover (or dumb) to understand right now.

links.title: You: ""Wait... I don't even know your nam..."
links.text: "Wait... I don't even know your name. Who are you?"

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""Call me Mañana. I'm just a humble..."
links.text: "Call me Mañana. I'm just a humble harbour-worker... for the past six, seven years."

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Mañana sounds like a mesque word, b..."
links.text: Mañana sounds like a mesque word, but he doesn't actually look much like a mesque.

links.title: Logic: "Not a given name, for certain. It's..."
links.text: Not a given name, for certain. It's a taken name -- the kind for artists, or criminals, or revolutionaries and the sort. An alias. A *nom de guerre*.

links.title: You: ""Mañana? You don't look like a Mesq..."
links.text: "Mañana? You don't look like a Mesque..."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""I'm not. I'm *Vacholiero*. Not all..."
links.text: "I'm not. I'm *Vacholiero*. Not all Mesques have the Mesque look, either, you know. Things in the real world are a bit more... fluid. Stuff ain't always what it appears to be."

links.title: You: ""Hold on, have you had any other na..."
links.text: "Hold on, have you had any other names?"

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""Plenty to go around. Don't get gre..."
links.text: "Plenty to go around. Don't get greedy and try to swipe mine, though." He smiles merrily. "You've got your own."

links.title: You: ""So it's a... nom de guerre?""
links.text: "So it's a... nom de guerre?"

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""A nom de guerre would be more like..."
links.text: "A nom de guerre would be more like *Guerra Mañana*." He chuckles. Then realizes something.

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""Now that we're getting so well acq..."
links.text: "Now that we're getting so well acquainted -- what's your name?"

links.title: You: ""It's been said I call myself *Tequ..."
links.text: "It's been said I call myself *Tequila Sunset*."

links.title: You: ""Honesty. I *lost* it while drinkin..."
links.text: "Honesty. I *lost* it while drinking."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""Wow! This is major! You're like......"
links.text: "Wow! This is major! You're like... a man born anew!" His eyes light up. "Okay, so if you can't find it, maybe make up a new one?"

links.title: You: ""I may take that into consideration.""
links.text: "I may take that into consideration."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""Can't live in this world without n..."
links.text: "Can't live in this world without names, see. Important things, they are. Vessels of the soul."

links.title: You: ""I've tried that. They don't like w..."
links.text: "I've tried that. They don't like what I came up with."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""Too bad. Can't live in this world..."
links.text: "Too bad. Can't live in this world without a good name, friend. Important things, they are. Vessels of the soul."

links.title: You: ""It sounds scary, I don't want to.""
links.text: "It sounds scary, I don't want to."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""Suit yourself. Yet one can't live..."
links.text: "Suit yourself. Yet one can't live nameless; names are important things. Vessels of the soul."

links.title: You: ""What's your deal with names, anyho..."
links.text: "What's your deal with names, anyhow? Is it a spiritual thing or a philosophical one or...?"

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""More a poetic thing. Any attempt t..."
links.text: "More a poetic thing. Any attempt to formulate a grand unified theory about it ends in the stupidest shit imaginable. Doesn't make it less true, though." He nods sagely.

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""That means I can't *tell* you abou..."
links.text: "That means I can't *tell* you about it. I can only *show* you. You may understand in time... or not. But it might be easy enough."

links.title: You: ""Fair enough. Seems interesting.""
links.text: "Fair enough. Seems interesting."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""Words guide our life, we commune w..."
links.text: "Words guide our life, we commune with each thing through its word. Every word is also a name, is it not?" He smiles.

links.title: You: ""Sounds stupid, is what I think.""
links.text: "Sounds stupid, is what I think."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""Yes, friend. The world is certainl..."
links.text: "Yes, friend. The world is certainly stupid enough to have stupid features." He grins.

links.title: You: ""Okay, I think might be Harry." (Co..."
links.text: "Okay, I think might be Harry." (Conclude.)

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""Harry..." he repeats. with a quizz..."
links.text: "Harry..." he repeats. with a quizzical expression. "It's cool. But I'm sure you could come up with something even cooler."

links.title: You: ""My name is Harrier Du Bois. I thin..."
links.text: "My name is Harrier Du Bois. I think." (Conclude.)

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""A strong, solid name telling of de..."
links.text: "A strong, solid name telling of dedication and honour." He gives a small salute. "Well met, Harrier."

links.title: You: ""All right then." (Conclude.)"
links.text: "All right then." (Conclude.)

links.title: Inland Empire: "Be honest with him."
links.text: Be honest with him.

links.title: You: ""So, not a given name, I take it?""
links.text: "So, not a given name, I take it?"

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""I'd say a real name is what most p..."
links.text: "I'd say a real name is what most people call you." He realizes something.

links.title: You: ""Call Me Mañana.. What kind of a na..."
links.text: "Call Me Mañana.. What kind of a name is that?"

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""It means *call me tomorrow*.""
links.text: "It means *call me tomorrow*."

links.title: You: ""Well met, Mañana. That's a sweet-a..."
links.text: "Well met, Mañana. That's a sweet-ass name."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""A name worthy of the man who holds..."
links.text: "A name worthy of the man who holds it, friend. Names are important."

links.title: You: ""Any idea who killed the hanged man?""
links.text: "Any idea who killed the hanged man?"

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""The mercenary, aye?" He shrugs. "W..."
links.text: "The mercenary, aye?" He shrugs. "Who could have killed him, that's indeed the question. Why even do such a thing?" He shakes his head solemnly.

links.title: You: ""The merc was hanged with a very sp..."
links.text: "The merc was hanged with a very specific type of a cargo belt. One often used in heavy transport areas, for example, harbours."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""What a thought!" He scoffs, lookin..."
links.text: "What a thought!" He scoffs, looking shocked. "Why would noble workers resort to such a thing. Unless they were *pushed*, of course."

links.title: You: ""Pushed how?""
links.text: "Pushed how?"

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""Your dead guy -- was an enemy comb..."
links.text: "Your dead guy -- was an enemy combatant."

links.title: You: ""The harbour is a prime area of sus..."
links.text: "The harbour is a prime area of suspicion. In your opinion -- are the dockworkers involved in the killing?"

links.title: You: ""Evrart says Titus Hardie and his b..."
links.text: "Evrart says Titus Hardie and his boys killed him."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""That so?" The man twirls his moust..."
links.text: "That so?" The man twirls his moustache around his finger. "I haven't heard anything about that. But if that's true... well, he was an enemy combatant."

links.title: You: ""Hold up, what does that mean?""
links.text: "Hold up, what does that mean?"

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""He was an agent of the opposition,..."
links.text: "He was an agent of the opposition, attempting to undermine our honourable efforts."

links.title: You: ""Did you kill him?""
links.text: "Did you kill him?"

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""I ain't the murderin' type. But th..."
links.text: "I ain't the murderin' type. But that's just me. Large organizations like our Union have all sorts of men -- with all sorts of skills."

links.title: Drama: "He believes the Hardie boys could'v..."
links.text: He believes the Hardie boys could've done it.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Understood." The lieutenant takes..."
links.text: "Understood." The lieutenant takes a note. "This has been of limited use -- still, thank you."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: ""No problem. I wish the best to you..."
links.text: "No problem. I wish the best to you in your search. Sure am glad it's not *my* search..." He takes a sip from his flask.

links.title: You: ""Thank you -- this has been of *lim..."
links.text: "Thank you -- this has been of *limited* use."

links.title: Drama: "He's not lying -- about not doing i..."
links.text: He's not lying -- about not doing it himself.

links.title: Half Light: "He means -- a more violent faction..."
links.text: He means -- a more violent faction could easily take care of such a thing.

links.title: You: ""Let's change the topic.""
links.text: "Let's change the topic."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: "The man whispers a jaunty tune. A c..."
links.text: The man whispers a jaunty tune. A coastal breeze ruffles his hair.

links.title: You: ""Okay, I have a name for myself, it..."
links.text: "Okay, I have a name for myself, it's..."

links.title: Inland Empire: "The encroaching doom is golden red...."
links.text: The encroaching doom is golden red. It is inside you, but also outside, on the horizon, by the water's edge. Innermost but yet to happen -- things make sense from that angle...

links.title: Inland Empire: "You're *Tequila Sunset*. You have a..."
links.text: You're *Tequila Sunset*. You have always been Tequila Sunset. It has always been too late.

links.title: You: ""The name's... Tequila Sunset.""
links.text: "The name's... Tequila Sunset."

links.title: Call Me Mañana: "He reaches his hand out to you and..."
links.text: He reaches his hand out to you and shouts: "Boiadeiro!"

links.title: Empathy: "The man is deeply moved. You see hi..."
links.text: The man is deeply moved. You see his eyes turn teary with appreciation. He is extremely happy for you.

links.title: You: "Shake his hand."
links.text: Shake his hand.

links.title: Call Me Mañana: "You receive a good, strong handshak..."
